occupation: Chief Operating Officer at Hickory Recovery Network
headline: Chief Operating Officer at Hickory Recovery Network
summary: Highly experienced professional, assisting start-up organizations in developing the necessary processes, procedures, staffing, and strategic growth plans. Results-oriented, high-energy, hands-on business development background with a successful record of accomplishments in sales, management, and marketing.  Major strengths include strong leadership, excellent communication skills, and motivational team player.  10 years of progressive experience with expertise in managing inside sales representatives, outside/field representatives, and telemarketers.  Demonstrated business management and marketing experience in new product/program development, revenue generation, and process improvement.  Proficient in areas of: staffing, training, budgeting, coaching, compliance, and data analytics.  Skilled in SalesForce, Talisma, KIPU, and Campusvue CRMs.

experiences.title: Director of Business Development
experiences.description: Hickory House Recovery is a small, private residential treatment program serving adult men and women suffering from addiction and addiction complicated by co-occurring mental illness located just outside of Indianapolis, in the Indiana countryside. At Hickory House Recovery we appreciate that each client is a unique individual who comes to us with their own experiences and needs. Our team creates comprehensive assessments and creative, customized treatment plans for each client. We work holistically, focusing on the mind-body connection to restore our clients’ to an authentic and meaningful life of recovery.

experiences.title: Director of Admissions and Career Services
Director of Admissions
experiences.description:
•	Consistent track record of exceeding yearly enrollment and revenue goals by constantly improving lead to enrollment conversions, start rates, and referral generation 
•	Manage staff, including but not limited to: adult and high school representatives/recruiters,  community relations, veteran, and International student representatives, admissions coordinators, and new student advisers 
•	Developed winning strategy for high school program; steady year after year growth in high school penetration, inquiry generation, lead to enrollment conversion, and start percentage 
•	Conduct regular trainings, coaching sessions, and observations to help motivate, develop, ensure product knowledge, and department/campus awareness to foster a healthy “team” environment 
•	Assist Corporate Marketing Team with the development and promotion of on and off-campus events, creation of advertising material, and new and exciting marketing initiatives (TV, radio, billboards, direct mail, text campaigns, community relations, veterans’ events, etc.) 
•	Analyze data to make strategic decisions and implement any necessary changes in the enrollment or marketing process(es) 
•	Evaluate and resolve student inquiries, issues, and disputes ensuring that the appropriate action is taken to the satisfaction of the student, Company, and regulatory agencies 
•	Integrated, as lead trainer, the roll-out of nationwide software programs, Talisma and Salesforce, as the Admissions Department transitioned from CampusVue software

experiences.company: The Art Institute of Ohio - Cincinnati
experiences.title: Associate Director Of Admissions
experiences.description:
•	Cultivated a strategy for local, national, and international inquiry generation and conversion,, database marketing, and the strategic development of referrals 
•	Managed Admission team of 22; drove team to 118% of plan for FY 2009 
•	Created staffing plans, training formats, development strategies, and motivational incentives; managed and conducted monthly, quarterly and annual reviews as metrics for continued improvement and success 
•	Authored admissions training manual for the campus 
•	Scheduled and conducted interviews, pursued qualified candidates for enrollment, and determined appropriateness of candidates for admission based upon career goals 
•	Consistently exceeded enrollment & start rate goals; multi-period team leader in sales 
•	Executed timely follow-up with all applicants to ensure successful matriculation; assisted cross-departmental personnel with data collection and problem solving

education.school: Northern Kentucky University—Salmon P. Chase College of Law

education.activities_and_societies: Delta Zeta, Latino Student Affairs, Mutlicultural Affiars, INROADS, NKU's mentoring program, International Honor Society
